meanings.definition: In a way that is imperceptible or unnoticeable.
meanings.sent1: The temperature dropped insensibly as the sun set.
meanings.sent2: She insensibly adjusted her position to get more comfortable.
meanings.sent3: He insensibly wandered into the wrong classroom, not realizing his mistake.
meanings.sent4: Time slipped insensibly through her fingers like sand.
meanings.sent5: The music faded insensibly into the background, barely audible.

meanings.sent1: He walked insensibly into the pole, not paying attention.
meanings.sent2: She insensibly hummed a tune while lost in thought.
meanings.sent3: The cat insensibly knocked over the vase, oblivious to the mess it caused.
meanings.sent4: The thief moved insensibly through the dark, avoiding detection.
meanings.sent5: The child slept insensibly through the thunderstorm, undisturbed.

meanings.sent1: His insensibly blunt comments offended many at the party.
meanings.sent2: The insensibly loud music made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent3: She wore an insensibly mismatched outfit to the event.
meanings.sent4: The insensibly bright lights blinded him momentarily.
meanings.sent5: The insensibly slow driver frustrated everyone on the road.
